text: Kashubian or Cassubian ; is a Lechitic language, a kind of Slavic language.Stephen Barbour, Cathie Carmichael, Language and Nationalism in Europe, Oxford University Press, 2000, p.199, About Languages - University of Leipzig It is spoken in the Polish region of Pomerania. Today the language is taught in some state schools. Since 2005 it has been protected in Poland as a regional language. It is the only language in Poland with this status. The status was given by an act of Polish Parliament on January 6, 2005. == References == Category:West Slavic languages Category:Languages of Poland language
title: Kashubian language
